mechanism.description: Weberian apparatus connects the anterior chamber of the swim bladder to the inner ear, enhancing hearing capability.

mechanism.description: Electric organ discharges (EODs) from Sachs' organ for electrolocation.

evidence.note: From provided context, E. electricus has three pairs of abdominal organs that produce electricity: the main organ, Hunter's organ, and Sachs' organ.

mechanism.description: Electric organs (Main organ, Hunter's organ) produce high voltage electric discharges for predation and defense.
